cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi ESE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the north-central Gulf, then slowing and turning north toward the southeast Louisiana ‑ Mississippi coast Tuesday, followed by a slow north-northeast drift inland through Alabama and into Georgia late Wednesday-Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi/Alabama border coast (around Biloxi, MS)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from the Mississippi/Alabama border to the Alabama/Florida border; Tropical Storm Watch Indian Pass to Ochlockonee River, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City, LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border; Tropical Storm Warning Mississippi/Alabama border to Indian Pass, FL; Storm Surge Warning Port Fourchon, LA to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward through the western Florida Panhandle, with inland impacts spreading into Mississippi, Alabama, and Georgia
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly to northeasterly winds 25-35 mph possible late Thursday as the weakening circulation passes inland west of the port; tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) are unlikely (≤6% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected on the Georgia coast because the center remains well inland and offshore winds dominate.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Thursday–Friday could total 4–6 inches, producing localized flash-flooding and ponding around the port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief spin-up tornadoes in outer rain bands cannot be ruled out as the remnant circulation crosses Georgia.
